intro: Sphanellolepis ciliata, commonly known as the silky sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the cooler months. Its root system is shallow and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in well-drained soils. Sphanellolepis ciliata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
